to suspect the identity of these two genera - a suspicion 
which was converted into a certainty by the researches of 
Cuvier who not only disentangled the nomenclature
of the genus from the confusion into which it had fallen 
but gave the first accurate idea of the anatomy of the 
Salpae, and first <s>described <\s> announced their true 
zoological relations -
Much was added piecemeal to the foundation thus laid 
<s>[text?]<\s> by Cuvier - by subsequent authors -
<s>Savigny <\s> Meyen & Milne Edwards described the nervous 
system - Kuhl & Von Hanell - Eschscholz and Milne 
Edwards - announced the singular nature of the circulation 
Cuvier <s>[text?]<\s> & Chamisso hinted - and Meyen 
described, the placental connexion of the solitary 
foetus with the parent; <s>Chamisso <\s> Eschnicht & Sars declared 
the <s>real<\s> proximate nature and mode of origin of the salpa chain
5 Chamisso again founded the theory of the 
“alternation of generation” - using that very 
phrase* - to express the <s>phenomenon <\s> peculiarities accurately 
observed by him, in the mode of multiplication 
of the Salpae - but the nature & existence of the sexual 
organs remained undetermined until Krohn 
& Steenstrup in 1846 - <s>[text?]<\s> discovered 
the <s>testis <\s> - male organs <s>and<\s> Subsequently,
Krohn, made out the true ovaries also 
Finally <s>the whole <\s> a most accurate account 
(to which indeed the present memoir can be considered 
only as confirmatory independent testimony) of 
the whole course of development & reproduction of 
the Salpae was given by Krohn in the 
Annales des Sciences for 1846 -
